context: The Finnish adjective 'ruskea' means brown in English. It's used to describe things that are brown in color, such as hair (ruskeat hiukset - brown hair), eyes (ruskeat silm채t - brown eyes), clothing items like trousers (ruskeat housut - brown pants), or natural phenomena like autumn foliage (ruska - autumn colors). It can be used to describe various shades of brown from light tan to dark chocolate brown.
